data.title: Howard under fire over plan for new G - G
data.meta_description: Prime Minister John Howard yesterday strongly defended outgoing Governor-General Peter Hollingworth and ruled out any changes to the system for appointing or sacking Australia's head of state.
data.text:
Prime Minister John Howard yesterday strongly defended outgoing Governor-General Peter Hollingworth and ruled out any changes to the system for appointing or sacking Australia's head of state.

Under fire from the opposition, Mr Howard appealed to Australians to set Dr Hollingworth's error of judgement on child sexual abuse against his lifetime of service to the underprivileged and to recognise that the Governor-General had paid a high price for his mistake.

Loading...
